sources.title: Are We Civilized?
sources.description: 1934 drama of man's inhumanity to man, starring William Farnum and Anita Louise, directed by Edwin Carewe, screenplay by Harold Sherman.

sources.title: Are We Civilized? (1934) WILLIAM FARNUM
sources.description:
Stars: William Farnum, Anita Louise, Frank McGlynn Sr. 
Director: Edwin Carewe

After being wounded defending the Fatherland in the Great War, a soldier travels to America where he rises to international prominence as owner of The World News Association. He returns to his native country to give a speech but is deeply disturbed by the Fascist dictatorship now ruling with an iron fist. When he delivers an oration denouncing the book burnings and censorship of the press that he has witnessed, he is forcibly removed from the podium. At his hotel he is confronted by brutal fascist henchmen, who demand that he publicly apologize for his statements or face death.

metadata.Plot: Paul is a European. He served in the army in the Great War. He emigrated to the USA. One day he returns to Europe and talks of freedom and liberty. The authorities (Nazi, but unnamed) come down on him. It is their duty to spread racism and religious hatred. Paul gives the speech of a lifetime set against an epic series of films spread across the history of mankind.
metadata.Actors: William Farnum, Anita Louise, Frank McGlynn Sr.
